reasoning: The critique targets a potentially important crux in the essay’s section-3 optimism: if many actors have non-discounting, linear-in-resources values, then compromise/trade may yield limited gains and could reduce the chance of a mostly-great future. The claim is clear and focused, with no dead weight, but its truth is uncertain and its unsupported nature keeps strength and overall score low.
title: Non-discounting linear views will dominate long-term resource allocation decisions
